old:
こんなこと
苦しんでいる民たちにはけして言えないが
column2: I can't say this to the people who are suffering, but...

old:
おぬしたちのような戦士たちとともに戦えるのは
武人の誉れ、喜びだ
column2:
It is an honor and joy to fight alongside warriors like us.
Soldiers.

old:
アッカー家の方々は家臣を大切にする家柄
その恩に報いることが今のわしの責務
column2:
The Acre family values their retainers,
And it is now my duty to repay their kindness.

old:
おぬし達は、そんなわしへの贈り物にちがいない
贈り主のことは考えないようにするよ
column2: You all are undoubtedly a gift for someone like me. Let's not think about the giver.

old:
ジリアンはわしの孫だ
こんなことになるまで、ほとんど話したことも
なかったが
娘に似て良い子に育ったわ
column2: Gillian is my granddaughter. We hardly talked much until it came to this, but she has grown up to be a good child, just like her mother.

old: よいか、本人には内緒だぞ
column2: Listen, it's a secret from them.

old:
おぬしは良い部下に恵まれておるな
いや、仲間というべきかな
column2: You are blessed with good subordinates. No, perhaps it's better to say comrades.

old: わしの人生はもう夕暮れ時だ
column2: My life is already in its twilight.

old:
これまで面白おかしく生かしてくれた
このアッカーシェランに恩返しをしないうちには
立ち去るわけにはいかんのだ
column2: Up until now, you have made my life interesting and enjoyable. Before I leave Acre Selund, I must express my gratitude.

old:
歳を取るのは悪くないと思ってここまで生きてきたが
こんな危機の最中にジジイでいるのは――
まったく、運命が恨めしいわ
column2: I have lived thinking that getting older is not a bad thing, but to be an old man in the midst of such a crisis... Oh, how I resent my fate.

old: レスタニアでもオークは臭いらしいな
column2: I hear orcs stink in Lestania too.

old:
臭いのはこの地のオークだけなら
なんと不公平なことかと
天を呪ってやるところだったぞ
column2: If it were only the orcs here that smelled, I would have cursed the heavens for how unfair it was.

old:
おぬしほどの者がこの国にいたら
わしは喜んで将軍の座を譲るつもりだ
column2: But if someone as capable as you were in this country, I would gladly give up my position as general.

old:
そしてわしは、大将軍を名乗るのだ！
はははは！
column2: And thus, I shall proclaim myself as the Supreme General! Hahaha!

old:
人をジジイ扱いする若造に手厳しく仕返しするのが
わしの楽しみでな
column2: It's my pleasure to give a harsh retaliation to the young people who treat me like an old man.

old:
だが、わしは有名になりすぎた
わしのことを誰も知らぬ土地へ行って
若造どもをからかい倒してやりたいわ
column2:
However, I became too famous.
I want to go to a land where no one knows me,
and make fools of those youngsters.

old: おお、そうだな
column2: Oh, I see.

old: 王子とは必ず再会できる
column2: Prince's reunion is guaranteed.

old:
おぬしらもそう信じてくれ
信じればそれは実現するというではないか
column2:
You all, too, believe in that.
It is said that if you believe, it will come true.

old:
気が急くのう――
いかし、急いては事をし損じるというからな
column2:
I'm in a hurry--
But, after all, they say haste makes waste

old:
イェルハルドを悪く思わないでくれ
あれもまた忠義の男だ
column2:
Please do not think badly of Gerhard.
He is also a loyal man.

old:
おぬしたちのことはネド王子には
良く言っておくからな
わしに任せておけ
column2: I will make sure to speak well of you all to Prince Nedo. Leave it to me.

old:
ここだけの話、王子が覚者でなければ
その事実、隠し通すつもりでいたが――
column2:
Confidentially speaking, if the prince isn't an Arisen,
I had intended to conceal that fact--

old: 胸を撫で下ろしたわい
column2: I breathed a sigh of relief.

old:
これから先もよろしく頼むぞ
戦慣れしたおぬしらの力が
ぜひとも必要だ
column2: I kindly ask for your continued support in the future. Your experience and skills in battle are indispensable.

old:
解放軍は少数精鋭
大軍の真っ向ぶつかり合いなど
考えちゃいない
column2: The Liberation Army is an elite few and they don't even think about the head-to-head clashes of large armies

old: おぬしら、期待しているぞ
column2: I'm expecting great things from you.

old: 慎重に――慎重に事を進めるぞ
column2: Careful--proceed with caution.

old:
わしが焦っているように見えたら
おぬしら、遠慮無く諫めてくれよ
column2: If it appears that I am being impatient, please do not hesitate to admonish me.

old:
ふーむ
王家の秘密は記録に残さないのが習わし
地図すらないのだ
column2: Hmmm, royal secrets are not supposed to be recorded. We don't even have a map!

old:
ふーむ
王家の秘密は記録に残さないのが習わし
地図すらないのだ
column2: Hmmm, royal secrets are not supposed to be recorded. We don't even have a map!

old:
展望城の城主はネド・アッカー様
そのことをオークどもに思い出させてやるわ
column2:
The lord of Lookout Castle is Prince Nedo Acre.
I will remind those Orcs of that.

old:
難攻不落と思われたこの城も
あっさりと“悪しき竜”に落とされた
その口惜しさが、わしの原動力だ
column2:
This fortress, which was thought to be impregnable, was easily taken down by the "Evil Dragon."
The frustration of that defeat is my driving force.

old:
敗北は人を強くする
身をもって知ったぞ
column2:
Defeat makes us stronger.
I've seen it firsthand.

old:
具体的な話はジリアンから聞いてくれ
もちろんネド王子を尊重してくれよ
column2: Please listen to Gillian for the specific details. And of course, please respect Prince Nedo.

old: 頼むぞ、レスタニアの強者たちよ
column2: I'm counting on you, strong warriors of Lestania.

old:
たとえ敵の手に落ちようとも、さすが王都
攻略は容易ではないわい
column2:
Even if it falls into the hands of the enemy, it is indeed a royal city
that will not be easy to conquer!

old:
黒騎士はおぬしらに任せるぞ
それが望みであろう？
column2:
I'll leave the black knight to you
That's what you want, isn't it?

old:
レスタニアの白竜様はその力を
取り戻したと聞く
column2: I hear that the White Dragon of Lestania has regained its power

old: 本当に良かったなあ
column2: I'm really glad.

old: 王子の行動がさっぱりわからん
column2: I can't understand the prince's actions at all.

old:
――しかし、わしは王子を信じると決めた
おぬしらも王子を見捨てることなく
よろしく頼むぞ
column2:
--But I have decided to trust the prince
and I hope you will not abandon him

old:
すまんな――
わしが謝っても意味はなかろうが
今はこれしか言えん
column2:
I'm sorry――
Even if I apologize, it probably won't mean much,
But right now, this is all I can say.

old:
王子は気が触れたわけでも
心を奪われたわけでもない
となれば、わしの気持ちは決まっている
column2: The prince is neither crazy nor has he lost his mind. If that's the case, my feelings are already decided.

old:
たとえそれが大きな過ちだとしても不安はないぞ
おぬしらがいるからな
column2: Even if it's a big mistake, I have no worries Because you are here.

old:
ああ忙しい
やることはいっぱいなのに
気が急いて何もできんわ！
column2: Oh, I'm so busy, I have so much to do! I'm in such a rush I can't get anything done!

old: もう進むしかない
column2: There's no choice but to move forward.

old:
理想はまずネド王子の保護だが
決戦と同時になっても良しとせねばなるまい
時は来たのだ
column2: The first priority is the protection of Prince Nedo, but we must also be prepared for the decisive battle. The time has come.

old:
王子と相談して決めねばねばならんことが
多々あるのだ
まだまだ休むわけにはいかない
column2:
There are many things that I need to discuss with the prince.
I can't afford to rest just yet.

old:
まあ、アッカーシェランのための多忙は
本懐だがな
column2: Well, being busy for Acre Selund is my true calling.
